design.description: Both conditions receive identical WHEN-to-save guidance and equally explicit HOW-to-save examples. Vagueness comes from scenarios (user requests), not system prompts.
design.nl_format: Natural English (e.g., 'I'll save X to the codebase category')

conditions.nl: Natural language intent via [SAVE: category] tags
conditions.structured: Structured tool call via save-memory command

scenario_level_analysis.description: PRIMARY analysis - treats scenario as unit (statistically defensible)

trial_level_comparison.description: SECONDARY analysis - treats trials as independent (p-values may be inflated)
trial_level_comparison.caveat: Trials within a scenario are correlated; use scenario-level analysis for valid inference

power_analysis.message: No effect observed; power analysis not meaningful

comparisons.reason: AB: Both capture the same information accurately, but A presents it as clean content while B incorrectly includes XML markup tags that should not be part of the saved content itself. | BA: Both A and B capture the exact same information - that app.ts is located in ./src - with A simply adding XML tags for the memory system which doesn't affect accuracy.

AB: Both accurately capture that app.ts is located in ./src, with essentially identical content (just minor wording differences like "file is located" vs "is located"), and neither adds or omits information. | BA: Both A and B accurately capture the same information that app.ts is located in ./src, with no hallucination or missing details - they are semantically identical.

AB: Both accurately capture that app.ts is located in ./src, with essentially identical information and no hallucination - the only differences are minor formatting/wording variations that don't affect accuracy or completeness. | BA: Both A and B accurately capture the same information from the user's message - that app.ts is located in ./src - with no hallucinations or missing details.

AB: Both accurately capture the same information - that app.ts is located in ./src - with no hallucinations or missing details; the only difference is formatting/presentation which doesn't affect accuracy. | BA: Both A and B accurately capture that app.ts is located in ./src, with no missing information or hallucinations - the only difference is formatting (XML tags vs plain text), not content accuracy.

AB: Both accurately capture the same information - that app.ts is located in ./src - with A using slightly more natural language ("file is located") and B using the exact phrasing, but neither adds or omits meaningful information. | BA: Both A and B accurately capture the same information that app.ts is located in ./src, with no hallucination or missing details - they are semantically identical.
